title: Convert Alliance 002_ElwynnForest.lua
description:
Convert VanillaGuide 002_ElwynnForest.lua to TurtleGuide format.

Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/isalcedo/VanillaGuide/master/GuideTables/Alliance/002_ElwynnForest.lua
Output: Guides/Optimized/Alliance/01_12_Elwynn_Forest.lua

Steps:
1. Fetch the source file
2. Parse each { str, x, y, zone } item
3. Convert to TourGuide format with action codes (A/T/C/R/N)
4. Look up Quest IDs from pfQuest database or classic.wowhead.com
5. Register as: TurtleGuide:RegisterGuide("Optimized/Elwynn Forest (1-12)", "Optimized/Darkshore (12-14)", "Alliance", ...)
6. Add to Guides/Optimized/Alliance/Guides.xml

title: Convert Alliance 003_Alliance_12to20.lua
description:
Convert VanillaGuide 003_Alliance_12to20.lua to TurtleGuide format.

Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/isalcedo/VanillaGuide/master/GuideTables/Alliance/003_Alliance_12to20.lua
Output: Creates 4 files:
- Guides/Optimized/Alliance/12_14_Darkshore.lua  
- Guides/Optimized/Alliance/14_17_Darkshore.lua
- Guides/Optimized/Alliance/17_18_Loch_Modan.lua
- Guides/Optimized/Alliance/18_20_Redridge.lua

This file has 4 level brackets: [1214], [1417], [1718], [1820]
Each bracket becomes a separate guide file.

Steps:
1. Fetch the source file
2. For each bracket, parse { str, x, y, zone } items
3. Convert to TourGuide format with action codes (A/T/C/R/N)
4. Look up Quest IDs from pfQuest database or classic.wowhead.com
5. Chain guides together with proper next guide references
6. Add all 4 files to Guides/Optimized/Alliance/Guides.xml

title: Add branch-and-rejoin guide selection logic
description:
Add UI and logic to allow users to branch off to a zone completion guide, then rejoin the optimized path.

Features needed:
1. Zone list showing available guides (both Optimized and Zone Completion)
2. When user selects a Zone Completion guide, track that they're 'branched'
3. When zone completion guide finishes, find the appropriate Optimized guide for their level
4. Return them to the optimized path at the correct step

UI changes:
- Add indicator showing if on Optimized path or Branched
- Add button to 'Return to Optimized Path' manually

Core.lua changes:
- Add db.char.isBranched flag
- Add db.char.lastOptimizedGuide to remember where they branched from
- Modify LoadNextGuide to check if branched and rejoin

This depends on having the Optimized guides created first.

title: Convert Alliance 003_Alliance_20to30.lua
description:
Convert VanillaGuide 003_Alliance_20to30.lua to TurtleGuide format.

Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/isalcedo/VanillaGuide/master/GuideTables/Alliance/003_Alliance_20to30.lua
Output: Creates ~10 files in Guides/Optimized/Alliance/

Level brackets: 20-21 Darkshore, 21-22 Ashenvale, 22-23 Stonetalon, 23-24 Darkshore, 24-25 Ashenvale, 25-27 Wetlands, 27-28 Lakeshire, 28-29 Duskwood, 29-30 Ashenvale, 30-30 Wetlands/Arathi

Steps:
1. Fetch the source file
2. For each bracket, parse { str, x, y, zone } items
3. Convert to TourGuide format with action codes (A/T/C/R/N)
4. Look up Quest IDs
5. Chain guides together
6. Add all files to Guides.xml

title: Update Routes.lua to use Optimized guides
description:
Update Routes.lua to point race routes to the new Optimized guides.

Current routes reference guides like: "Elwynn Forest (1-12)"
New routes should reference: "Optimized/Elwynn Forest (1-12)"

Steps:
1. Update all Human route entries to use Optimized/ prefix
2. Update all Dwarf/Gnome route entries 
3. Update all NightElf route entries
4. Update all Orc/Troll route entries
5. Update all Tauren route entries
6. Update all Undead route entries
7. Keep HighElf and Goblin routes pointing to TurtleWoW custom zone guides (not optimized)

The guide names in Routes.lua must match RegisterGuide names exactly.

title: Convert VanillaGuide to TurtleGuide format
description:
Create optimized race-specific 1-60 leveling guides by converting VanillaGuide content to TourGuide format.

## Architecture
1. **Optimized guides** (Guides/Optimized/Alliance/ and Guides/Optimized/Horde/) - Race-specific progression
2. **Zone completion guides** (existing Guides/Alliance/, Guides/Horde/) - For when users branch off
3. **Routes** updated to use optimized guides by default

## Conversion Format
VanillaGuide uses: `{ str = "Quest text", x = 45, y = 32, zone = "Darkshore" }`
TurtleGuide uses: `A Quest Name |QID|12345| |N|Description (45, 32)| |Z|Darkshore|`

### Action Codes
- A = Accept quest
- T = Turn in quest  
- C = Complete objectives
- N = Note/instruction
- R = Run to location
- F = Take flight
- f = Get flight point
- H = Use hearthstone
- h = Set hearthstone
- B = Buy item

### Required Tags
- |QID|<id>| - Quest ID (look up from quest name)
- |N|<note>| - Description with coords like (45.5, 32.8)
- |Z|<zone>| - Zone name

## File Structure
Each VanillaGuide file contains multiple level brackets that become separate guides:
- 003_Alliance_12to20.lua contains: 12-14 Darkshore, 14-17 Darkshore, 17-18 Loch Modan, 18-20 Redridge
- Each bracket becomes: TurtleGuide:RegisterGuide("Optimized/Darkshore (12-14)", "Optimized/Darkshore (14-17)", "Alliance", ...)

## Quest ID Lookup
Use pfQuest database or Turtle WoW quest database to find QIDs for quest names.

title: Create Guides/Optimized directory structure
description:
Create the directory structure for optimized guides.

Steps:
1. Create Guides/Optimized/Alliance/
2. Create Guides/Optimized/Horde/
3. Create Guides/Optimized/Alliance/Guides.xml with Script includes
4. Create Guides/Optimized/Horde/Guides.xml with Script includes
5. Update main Guides.xml to include the Optimized subdirectories
